verses.roman:
ardha-mārā jīva yadi dhaḍ-phaḍa kare
tabe ta' ānanda mora bāḍaye antare"

synonyms: ardha-mārā jīva—half-killed living beings; yadi—if; dhaḍ-phaḍa kare—twist and turn because of suffering; tabe—then; ta'-certainly; ānanda—pleasure; mora—my; bāḍaye antare—increases within.
translation: " 'When I see half-killed animals suffer, I feel great pleasure.'
